main_definition: To stand for or symbolize something; to act as a sign of, emblem, or metaphor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stand for or symbolize an idea, concept, or object
To act as a sign or metaphor that conveys a particular meaning
meanings_and_examples.example: His silence represents his deep regret for what he had done.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To represent in terms of numbers or quantities, often used in statistics and mathematics
meanings_and_examples.example: The average age of the group represents 35 years.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To officially select a person to act on behalf of others; to appoint as an ambassador, delegate, or representative
meanings_and_examples.example: She was chosen to represent her country at the international conference.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In business, to depict in terms of market share or percentage of a particular segment or industry
meanings_and_examples.example: This brand represents 20% of the global smartphone market.
